main event: A witness reported seeing a bright, irregular light in the sky over Hong Kong on November 28, 1955.
interesting points: The light was observed for about 10 minutes and changed position multiple times., The source of the light appeared to be stationary initially before moving diagonally., It did not resemble any known aircraft, such as a plane or helicopter., The account was sent to the editor of the South China Morning Post, highlighting a lack of media coverage., An editorial note referred to the sighting as a 'coincidental psychological illusion.'
sighted object: a bright, irregular light in the sky
witness description: two individuals who observed the light together
